The '''Castello di Caccamo''' ({{lang-en|'''Caccamo Castle'''}}) is a [[castle]] in [[Caccamo]], [[Sicily]]. It is among the largest and best preserved Norman castles in Sicily, and one of the largest in [[Italy]].<ref name=sicilianodyssey>{{cite web|last1=Pienta|first1=Maryellen|title=The Castle of Caccamo|url=http://sicilianodyssey.blogspot.com/2008/02/castle-of-caccamo.html|website=sicilianodyssey.blogspot.com|accessdate=16 May 2015|date=20 February 2008}}</ref>
The castle is built on a steep cliff, 521 metres above sea level. It overlooks the surrounding countryside, including the San Leonardo River Valley, and the Rosmarina artificial lake.<ref>{{cite web|title=Castles in Sicily|url=http://www.sicilyincoming.com/castles.html|website=sicilyincoming.com|accessdate=16 May 2015}}</ref>
==History== The site of the Castello di Caccamo was probably originally occupied by an Arab fortress. The castle as it is today was built by [[Matthew Bonnellus]] in the 12th century. It was later modified by the [[Chiaramonte]]s in the 14th century, and by other rulers until the 17th century.<ref>{{cite web|title=Termini Imerese|url=http://www.bestofsicily.com/termini.htm|website=Best of Sicily|accessdate=16 May 2015|date=April 2008}}</ref>
The castle is a large structure built of white stone, having an irregular plan. It has walls with V-shaped [[battlements]], towers, a moat and a courtyard. The interior consists of a maze of rooms and stairways.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Orlando|first1=Andrea|title=Castello Di Caccamo|url=http://www.icastelli.it/castle-1234885568-castello_di_caccamo-it.php|website=iCastelli.it|accessdate=16 May 2015|language=it}}</ref>
The most notable room within the castle is the ''Sala della Congiura'', also known as the Conspiracy Hall. In 1160, some Norman barons met in this room to plot against [[William I of Sicily]], but the rebellion failed.
Parts of the castle collapsed in an earthquake in 1923.<ref>{{cite web|title=Il castello di Caccamo|url=http://www.ioamolasicilia.com/il-castello-di-caccamo/|website=Io amo la Sicilia|accessdate=16 May 2015|date=9 May 2013|language=it}}</ref>
The castle was inhabited by descendants of the Dukes of Caccamo until it was purchased by the [[Sicily|Region of Sicily]] in October 1963. By this time, the castle was in ruins. Restoration work funded by the Region of Sicily began in 1974.<ref>{{cite web|title=Salone dei Duchi e dei Baroni|url=http://www.castellana.it/sale/salone-dei-duchi-e-dei-baroni|website=A Castellana|accessdate=16 May 2015|language=it}}</ref>
==Present day== Today, the castle is open to the public. A restaurant called ''A Castellana'' is located on the ground level of the castle,<ref>{{cite web|title=A Castellana|url=http://www.castellana.it/|website=A Castellana|accessdate=16 May 2015|language=it}}</ref> while other parts of the structure are also used for conferences and meetings.<ref name=sicilianodyssey/>
